findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled, the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop addresses from transactions. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `blacklistAddress` function.

findings.title: EPC - Existing Pair Creation
findings.description: The contract does not handle the scenario where a pair already exists prior to its execution in the openTrading function, which can lead to a situation where the openTrading function cannot be executed if a pair is already created, potentially blocking trading.

findings.title: RFM - Redundant Fee Mechanism
findings.description: The contract declares variables and functions as part of a fee mechanism, but this mechanism is not being used by the transaction flow. As a result, these variables and functions are redundant.

findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, creating inconsistencies and undermining safety measures.

findings.title: FSA - Fixed Swap Address
findings.description: The swap address is assigned once and cannot be changed, which may prevent the contract from catching up to upgrades or migrating to a new liquidity pool pair or decentralized exchange.

findings.title: ULTW - Transfers Liquidity to Team Wallet
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer funds without limit to the `_taxWallet` wallet, which may take advantage of it by calling the `manualSwap` method.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations resistant to integer overflows and underflows.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards, but does not use the 'immutable' declaration which can save gas.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can lead to decreased readability and maintainability.
